message.content:
Below is one systematic way to “read off” the tower from the pictures and match each piece to the block‐dictionary images (without rotating any of them).  I have broken the solution into three parts, as requested.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN (TARGET) IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

•  Total Structures and Block Count  
   There are two separate little towers.  In total, they use 19 blocks:
   –  Left (smaller) tower uses 3 blocks.  
   –  Right (larger) tower uses 16 blocks.

•  Left (smaller) Tower  
   –  Bottom layer: One short green rectangular prism.  
   –  Middle layer: One upright orange cylinder (centered on the green block).  
   –  Top layer: One orange “roof” wedge perched on the cylinder.  

•  Right (larger) Tower (7 layers):
   1.  Bottom layer: Two red arch‐shaped blocks side by side.  
   2.  Second layer: A “ring” of four short yellow blocks around the top of the arches.  
   3.  Third layer: Two red arch‐shaped blocks again, this time oriented so the arch opens upward.  
   4.  Fourth layer: Another ring of four short yellow blocks.  
   5.  Fifth layer: Two tall green rectangular prisms (the “columns”) standing side by side.  
   6.  Sixth layer: One wide yellow block bridging across the two green columns.  
   7.  Top layer: One orange wedge block sitting in the center as the roof.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING THE CORRECT BLOCKS AND INDICES
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

From the block‐dictionary image, the required pieces (with their dictionary indices) are as follows:

A)  Left Tower (3 blocks)  
   •  Green rectangular base → index 4  
   •  Orange upright cylinder → index 9  
   •  Orange roof wedge (oriented as shown) → index 14  

B)  Right Tower (16 blocks)  
   •  Red arch blocks (arch on bottom) → index 1 (×2)  
   •  Red arch blocks (arch on top) → index 2 (×2)  
   •  Short yellow rectangular blocks (for the two “rings”) → index 6 (×8 total, four per ring)  
   •  Tall green rectangular pillars → index 5 (×2)  
   •  Wide yellow bridging block (spanning the pillars at the top) → index 8 (×1)  
   •  Orange roof wedge (same orientation as the small tower’s roof) → index 14 (×1)  

In summary, the dictionary indices needed are:
 •  #1 (2×), #2 (2×), #4 (1×), #5 (2×), #6 (8×), #8 (1×), #9 (1×), and #14 (2×).  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one logical order (you may of course reorder so long as you build bottom‐to‐top).

{
 Step1:  Move block with index 4   (place the small green base for the left tower)
 Step2:  Move block with index 9   (stand the orange cylinder on the green base)
 Step3:  Move block with index 14  (add the orange wedge roof on top of the cylinder)

 -- Begin the right tower --
 Step4:  Move block with index 1   (first red arch on bottom layer)
 Step5:  Move block with index 1   (second red arch on bottom layer)
 Step6:  Move block with index 6   (first yellow block of the second-layer ring)
 Step7:  Move block with index 6   (second yellow block of that ring)
 Step8:  Move block with index 6   (third yellow block of that ring)
 Step9:  Move block with index 6   (fourth yellow block of that ring)
 Step10: Move block with index 2   (first red arch of the third layer)
 Step11: Move block with index 2   (second red arch of the third layer)
 Step12: Move block with index 6   (first yellow block of the fourth-layer ring)
 Step13: Move block with index 6   (second yellow block of that ring)
 Step14: Move block with index 6   (third yellow block of that ring)
 Step15: Move block with index 6   (fourth yellow block of that ring)
 Step16: Move block with index 5   (first tall green column)
 Step17: Move block with index 5   (second tall green column)
 Step18: Move block with index 8   (wide yellow block bridging the two columns)
 Step19: Move block with index 14  (orange wedge roof on top)
}

That completes the structure shown in the target image, using each block just as it appears in the dictionary (no rotations beyond what is shown).
